title: 'Pressure to crack NEET’: Teen shoots father in front of sister; chops up body, stuffs it into blue drum
content: A 19-year-old allegedly shot his father dead over NEET pressure, then dismembered the body. He attempted to dispose of the remains, but was caught by police while trying to hide the torso. The accused confessed after being intercepted with suspicious activity. Investigations are ongoing to recover all body parts.

title: Pawan Hans helicopter, with 7 onboard, crashes into sea in Andaman; all rescued
content: A Pawan Hans helicopter experienced a short landing near Mayabunder in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands shortly after departing Port Blair. The aircraft was carrying two crew members and five passengers. Fortunately, all individuals were safely rescued with no reported injuries. Authorities are investigating the incident, and those on board are receiving medical observation.

title: Trump's tariff game might not be over just yet, here's what US is planning
content: Following a Supreme Court setback, the US is launching new national security probes into sectors like batteries and telecom equipment, potentially leading to fresh tariffs. President Trump also threatened higher duties on countries exploiting the ruling, aiming to replace invalidated levies with legally sustainable measures under Section 232 and Section 301.

title: 'India not going to hold back': Zimbabwe brace for aggressive backlash in do-or-die clash
content: Zimbabwe's coach anticipates a fierce Indian onslaught in Chennai, drawing parallels to their recent defeat against the West Indies.  He stressed the need for his team to adapt and disrupt India's aggressive batting, particularly Suryakumar Yadav.  Zimbabwe aim to learn from their previous loss and challenge the tournament favourites on a Chennai pitch offering unexpected pace and bounce.

title: Google bans OpenClaw users on its AI coding tool Antigravity
content: Google has restricted access to its AI coding platform Antigravity for users routing Gemini tokens through OpenClaw, citing "malicious usage" that degraded the service. This action, which caught developers off guard, aims to curb exploitation of compute resources and ensure fair access for paying subscribers. Google is working to restore access for affected users.

title: 'Peaceful protest our right': Rahul backs Youth Congress after chief's arrest
content: Rahul Gandhi lauded Indian Youth Congress members for protesting against Prime Minister Narendra Modi. He stated, "Peaceful protest is our historic heritage. It is in our blood and is the democratic right of every Indian." Gandhi criticized a trade deal with America, claiming it compromises national interests and harms farmers and the textile industry.

title: ‘Engine failure’ prompts mayday call; SpiceJet flight makes emergency landing in Delhi
content: A SpiceJet Boeing 737 carrying 150 passengers returned to Delhi shortly after takeoff for Leh due to a reported engine failure. The aircraft, which departed at 6:08 am, landed safely at 6:49 am. SpiceJet confirmed a technical issue, stating the aircraft landed normally with no fire warning.

title: Why is stock market down? Nifty50 below 25,450; BSE Sensex drops 900 points - top reasons
content: Stock market crash today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex tanked in trade on Tuesday on weak global cues and IT stocks rout along with fresh tariff threats from US President Donald Trump. While Nifty50 dropped over 260 points, BSE Sensex went below the 82,400.

title: America's biggest investor has an 'end question' for tech giants
content: Investor Michael Burry is questioning Big Tech's massive AI spending, highlighting concerns over ballooning debt and accounting practices. Companies are investing hundreds of billions in AI infrastructure, leading to significant borrowing and potential overstatement of earnings. Burry draws parallels to the early electricity boom, where transformative technology didn't prevent investor losses.

title: Axar snub raises questions: Why was Washington picked ahead of India vice-captain?
content: India's team management prioritised match-ups over vice-captaincy, benching Axar Patel for Washington Sundar against South Africa in their Super 8 clash. Despite Axar's strong record, Sundar was chosen for his off-spin against left-handers. This decision, along with Sundar's batting position, has raised questions about the team's strategy as they enter the tournament's crucial stages.

title: Congress seeks 35 seats in Tamil Nadu, DMK offers 28 citing larger alliance
content: Congress is pushing for 35 seats in the upcoming elections, but alliance leader DMK is reportedly offering only a slight increase from their 2021 count of 25. Talks are ongoing, with Congress also seeking more local body posts and a Rajya Sabha seat. DMK acknowledges the need to accommodate new allies, potentially impacting seat allocations.

title: Great news! Rs 5.16 crore toll refund for Mumbai-Pune Expressway jam
content: Motorists stranded in the massive Mumbai-Pune Expressway traffic jam on February 3 will receive a Rs 5.16 crore toll refund. Over one lakh vehicle owners will have their FASTag accounts credited directly. The decision follows a gas tanker overturning, causing a 33-hour disruption and automatic toll deductions despite a suspension order.

title: Anthropic AI tool wipes millions off CrowdStrike value; CEO shares Claude’s reply
content: CrowdStrike's CEO George Kurtz countered fears of AI disruption after Anthropic's new tool impacted cybersecurity stocks. He revealed that Anthropic's own AI, Claude, stated it couldn't replace CrowdStrike's complex platform. Analysts suggest the market overreacted, as the AI tool lacks real-time threat detection capabilities, a core function of companies like CrowdStrike.

title: Vicky Kaushal praises Katrina, calls her warrior, talks about son Vihaan
content: Vicky Kaushal and Katrina Kaif welcomed their son, Vihaan Kaushal, in November 2025. Vicky recently praised Katrina as a "superhero" and "warrior" mother, expressing immense pride. He also humorously claimed to be better at changing diapers than acting, while admitting the emotional difficulty of leaving his son so soon after his birth.

title: 'Mistakes happen': Steve Bucknor regrets giving Sachin Tendulkar out 22 years ago
content: Former umpire Steve Bucknor has admitted to making a mistake in a controversial LBW decision against Sachin Tendulkar during the 2003-04 Brisbane Test. Bucknor confessed that Tendulkar should not have been given out, as the ball was missing the stumps. This admission confirms long-held fan beliefs about the erroneous call.

title: Bengal SIR: SC asks EC to bear cost for deploying out-of-state judicial officers
content: The Supreme Court has authorized the Calcutta High Court Chief Justice to bring in judicial officers from Jharkhand and Odisha to speed up the verification of voter claims in West Bengal's electoral roll revision. This move aims to address a significant backlog, with the Election Commission bearing the costs.

title: Gold price prediction: Will gold prices continue their uptrend?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices may continue to rise if the US dollar weakness persists, says Praveen Singh, Senior Fundamental Research Analyst- Currencies and Commodities at Mirae Asset Sharekhan:

title: Took off, lost contact in 20 minutes: How a medical evacuation flight from Jharkhand ended in tragedy
content: A medical evacuation flight from Ranchi to Delhi crashed in Jharkhand's Chatra district on Monday evening, killing all seven people on board. The aircraft requested a deviation due to bad weather shortly after takeoff before losing radar contact. An investigation is underway to determine the exact cause of the crash.

title: 'Provided logistics' for 'shirtless' protest: Why Delhi Police arrested youth Congress chief
content: Delhi Police arrested Indian Youth Congress chief Uday Bhanu Chib and seven others for a shirtless protest at Bharat Mandapam during the AI Summit. The Youth Congress condemned the arrests as "an undeclared emergency," while Congress spokesperson Pawan Khera criticized the government's reaction to peaceful dissent. Protesters displayed anti-PM slogans.

title: Refusal to marry after intimacy over ‘kundali’ mismatch can attract BNS charges: HC
content: Refusing marriage after a physical relationship, based on a horoscope mismatch despite prior assurances, can now lead to charges under Section 69 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita for deceitful sexual intercourse. The Delhi High Court made this observation while denying bail to a man accused of such actions, highlighting repeated promises of marriage that were later broken.

title: IND vs ZIM: ‘Fresh’ Chepauk pitch should bring welcome relief for India
content: Team India's T20 struggles have put pitch conditions under scrutiny ahead of their must-win game against Zimbabwe.  Chennai's Chepauk pitch, traditionally slow, has surprisingly offered better bounce this World Cup, potentially aiding India's big-hitters against Zimbabwe's pace-off bowlers.  Batting first appears to be the preferred strategy given recent night-game results.

title: FM Sitharaman rules out roadmap for PSU bank mergers, panel to review sector reforms
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman stated there is no roadmap for public sector bank mergers, indicating consolidation is not actively considered. A new banking reform panel will review the sector's future, examining all aspects to strengthen the ecosystem and align it with India's growth goals.

title: Anthropic Claude Code tool impact: IBM share price crashes most in 25 years
content: Since the majority of mainframe computers running COBOL are produced by IBM, the development triggered heavy selling in the company’s stock. The stock dropped as much as 13% during intraday trading, marking its steepest single-day fall since March 2020.

title: Ex-Nato commander warns US Middle East buildup mirrors 'Dante’s Inferno'
content: Former NATO commander Admiral James Stavridis likened the US military buildup around Iran to "Dante's Inferno," describing concentric rings of firepower.  This massive deployment includes strategic bombers, two aircraft carrier groups, and Tomahawk missile capabilities.  The move comes amid escalating US-Iran tensions, with Washington ordering non-essential staff out of Lebanon and Tehran vowing fierce retaliation against any strike.

title: IT stocks fall today: Infosys, TCS, HCL plunge sharply — what triggered the sell-off?
content: IT stocks experienced a sharp decline as Anthropic's Claude Code tool showed potential to modernize legacy COBOL systems. This development triggered concerns about AI's impact on traditional IT services, with major players seeing significant drops in their share prices. The news highlights a growing unease about AI fundamentally reshaping the industry's competitive landscape and business models.

title: Mexico drug lord El Mencho killed; cartel rampage halts cities: What happened in last 24 hrs
content: Mexico experienced intense cartel violence following the military operation that killed drug lord "El Mencho." The retaliation included arson, blockades, and gun battles across multiple states, prompting the deployment of 10,000 troops. Authorities tracked and killed the CJNG leader, but his death has led to widespread unrest and a prison break.

title: Wobble at top: India rethink options as left-heavy top order keeps misfiring
content: India's T20 World Cup campaign faces a crisis as the much-hyped top order falters, leading to predictable collapses and growing doubts. Opposition teams have easily decoded the batting lineup, forcing management to consider significant changes. The team's batting coach acknowledges the need for a different approach, hinting at potential alterations for upcoming crucial matches.

title: T20 World Cup: How Babar Azam went from 'King' to 'match ka mujrim'
content: Once hailed as Pakistan’s next batting great, Babar Azam now finds himself under intense scrutiny. Despite towering career numbers, his poor strike rate, powerplay struggles, and inability to adapt to modern T20 demands have eroded his aura. As Pakistan rethink roles and combinations, Babar’s place, purpose, and future in the format hang in the balance.

title: Stephen Curry and Ayesha Curry’s viral relationship test reveals surprises
content: Stephen and Ayesha Curry's enduring relationship was highlighted in a viral relationship test. It revealed personal details like nicknames, favorite features, and even their first realization of mutual interest. The couple, married since 2011, met as teenagers and reconnected in 2008, showcasing their strong bond through shared knowledge and playful interactions.

title: Shikhar Dhawan slams fake quotes after wedding to Sophie, urges ‘love & positivity’
content: Shikhar Dhawan has publicly refuted fabricated social media quotes concerning his personal life post-marriage to Sophie Shine. The cricketer expressed disappointment over misinformation, emphasizing his respect for the past and his focus on a positive new chapter. He urged fans to avoid spreading false statements and instead promote love and positivity, thanking them for their support.

title: Yunus returns to non-profit work after 18 months leading Bangladesh interim government
content: Muhammad Yunus has returned to his non-profit work at the Yunus Centre after an 18-month tenure as chief adviser to Bangladesh's interim government. He was welcomed by colleagues and met with Grameen organisations to review paused initiatives. Yunus will also resume living at his personal residence in Dhaka.

title: T20 World Cup: Will rain play spoilsport in PAK vs ENG Super 8 clash?
content: The Pakistan vs England T20 World Cup Super 8 match in Kandy is expected to be played under favourable weather conditions. Temperatures will be around 19°C with mostly clear skies and light winds. Rain chances are low at 13%, with minimal thunderstorm risk. Weather interruptions are unlikely, so a full 20-over match is expected, shifting focus to pitch conditions and team performance.

title: Uttarakhand woman gang-raped at gunpoint, finger slashed as accused film video
content: A married woman was allegedly gangraped at gunpoint in Rudrapur by three armed men while returning from a fair. The attackers, known to her brother-in-law, forced them to a deserted area, committed the assault, and recorded a video. The survivor filed a complaint, and police are investigating.

title: Silent signs of high blood pressure you shouldn’t ignore
content: High blood pressure is a stealthy adversary, frequently presenting with gentle clues that can escalate into serious health crises. Medical professionals point out that symptoms like nagging headaches upon waking, unexpected fatigue, trouble catching your breath, lightheadedness, and fuzzy vision could be warning signs.

title: 'Shirtless' protest at AI summit: Youth Congress chief Uday Bhanu Chib arrested
content: Delhi Police have apprehended Indian Youth Congress National President Uday Bhanu Chib following a protest at Bharat Mandapam.  The incident involved a shirtless demonstration inside an AI expo hall, with slogans targeting the Prime Minister.  Chib's arrest brings the total detentions in the case to eight, including other IYC office-bearers.

title: Why so many women are low on iron, and don’t realise it
content: Across various aspects of modern life, women frequently report feeling exhausted, attributing it to their hectic schedules. Nevertheless, healthcare providers indicate that overlooked low iron levels may be a significant contributor. This silent deficiency disproportionately impacts women, particularly during menstrual cycles and pregnancy.

title: Maria Shriver shares deatails on Eric Dane's health struggles
content: Veteran journalist Maria Shriver is mourning the death of 'Grey’s Anatomy' star Eric Dane, who has passed away following his courageous fight with ALS.

title: Govind Namdev recalls there's food hierarchy on film set in Bollywood
content: Veteran actor Govind Namdev has highlighted the stark inequality on film sets, from creative discussions to meal arrangements, citing a rigid hierarchy. He praised Akshay Kumar and director Umesh Shukla for fostering an egalitarian environment during 'Oh My God!', where everyone received the same treatment and food, a rarity in Bollywood.

title: 'He will lead the pack': Trump denies top military adviser opposed potential war with Iran
content: President Trump has dismissed reports that General Daniel Caine warned against a potential war with Iran, calling them "100% incorrect." Trump stated Caine believes any conflict would be "easily won" and that he himself would make the final decision on military action.  Meanwhile, the US is reinforcing its military presence in the region, fueling concerns of a wider confrontation.

title: Mosque at Bhojshala built using parts of ancient temples: ASI
content: An Archaeological Survey of India report, submitted to the MP High Court, concludes the Kamal Maula Mosque at Bhojshala was built using parts of ancient temples. Scientific investigations reveal the structure, dating back to the Paramara dynasty, incorporates dismantled temple remains. The court has directed parties to file objections on the findings.

title: Sources: WNBA sets deadline to keep '26 intact
content: The WNBA told the union and its teams on Monday that a new CBA should be agreed to by March 10 for the 2026 schedule not to be impacted, sources told ESPN.

title: Mayweather-Pacquiao 2 set for Sept. at Sphere
content: Eleven years after their first fight, Floyd Mayweather Jr. and Manny Pacquiao will meet again in a professional boxing rematch Sept. 19 at the Sphere in Las Vegas.

title: Kansas rebounds, hands Houston 3rd straight loss
content: Tre White scored a season-high 23 points, and No. 14 Kansas bounced back from a surprising defeat to hand No. 5 Houston its third straight loss.

title: Spurs pass 'test' in physical clash with Pistons
content: The Spurs won their ninth straight game, beating the Pistons in a potential NBA Finals preview Monday night.

title: U.S. women's hockey team declines Trump invite
content: The U.S. women's hockey Olympic gold medal-winning team has politely declined an invitation from President Donald Trump to attend his State of the Union address.

title: Grand jury doesn't indict Beverley in assault case
content: A grand jury returned a no-bill in the case involving former NBA guard Patrick Beverley, who was arrested last fall in what police called a "family violence" incident.

title: Sources: Mexico game still on amid cartel violence
content: Mexico plans to proceed with its friendly match scheduled against Iceland on Wednesday at the Corregidora Stadium in Queretaro amid unrest and violence in the country, sources told ESPN.

title: QB Rivers follows in dad Philip's path to NC State
content: Four-star quarterback Gunner Rivers, son of NC State legend and eight-time NFL Pro Bowler Philip Rivers, has committed to the Wolfpack.

title: NFL free agency tiers: Barnwell ranks the best QBs, RBs, WRs, TEs and OL
content: NFL free agency is almost here, and we placed players on offense into tiers based on their potential offseason contracts. Who could get paid?

title: Draft intel: Who is the best player in the class? Could Vegas trade out of No. 1?
content: We asked NFL execs, scouts and players to weigh in on the Raiders' No. 1 pick and the best prospects in 2026.

title: 'The time is now': Inside the Darryn Peterson availability saga at Kansas
content: The projected No. 1 NBA draft pick has sat out enough time to cast uncertainty on his team's potential in March.

title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: OU, Iowa and TCU on the rise
content: The new AP Top 25 is here! Which teams moved up? Which team replaced Tennessee, which fell out of the poll?

title: Men's Bubble Watch: Welcome to the 'locks,' Wisconsin
content: Wisconsin cemented its status as a 'lock' Sunday, though the SEC continues to lead the Big Ten in projected bids.

title: As NIL cash grows, coaches call for rules to protect athletes from 'street agents'
content: Coaches and other observers see a growing need to protect athletes by regulating middlemen in NIL deals.

title: We predicted the 12-man USA basketball roster in the 2028 Olympics
content: In a time of transition for USA basketball, here's what the 12-man squad that will go up against a competitive international slate could look like.

title: Why pitch tipping is going to be the most talked-about term in 2026
content: With a new rule already in place, MLB front offices are cracking down on another tiny way to get an advantage.

title: Who makes Team USA in men's hockey at the 2030 Olympics?
content: While the 2026 roster returns home with medals, here's who could represent the U.S. in the French Alps Games.

title: Dreams on paper, gold on ice: Revisiting Jack Hughes' and Alysa Liu's 2019 letters
content: In 2019, Hughes and Liu wrote to their retired selves. In 2026, they added Olympic gold to the story.

title: Arsenal back on track after big derby win; Real Madrid suffer shock LaLiga loss; more
content: Arsenal didn't panic ahead of Sunday's north London derby, and it paid off. Plus: Man City keep the pressure on, and Real Madrid suffer a shock to fall behind again in LaLiga.

title: Man United's successful summer signings provide hope for the future
content: Man United are looking to qualify for the Champions League, and their signings might help them get there.

title: Nine tips to help you win your league
content: Nine tips to use during the fantasy baseball season, from trade strategies to how to value rookies and closers

title: Fantasy basketball pickups: Pick up Melton, Wallace and Raynaud for the homestretch
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Fantasy hockey pickups: Why Dostal, Laferriere are post-Olympics must-adds
content: The essential Monday guide to fantasy hockey pickups, with who to add and how to get set for the week ahead.

title: No files signed, no certificates issued on day of Ajit Pawar's death, says Maharashtra Minority Department
content: The clarification comes amid a controversy over the alleged hasty grant of minority status to 75 educational institutions in the days following the death of Ajit Pawar

title: West Bengal SIR hearing: Supreme Court asks Calcutta HC to deploy more judicial officers
content: Supreme Court asks the Calcutta High Court Chief Justice to borrow judicial officers from neighbouring Odisha and Jharkhand

title: Modi government has abandoned Palestinians: Congress slams PM’s upcoming Israel visit
content: The Modi government makes cynical and hypocritical statements on its commitment to the cause of the Palestinians, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said

title: PM Modi congratulates Netherlands’ new PM Rob Jetten
content: PM Modi said he is looking forward to working closely with his Netherlands’ counterpart Rob Jetten to add further momentum to the growing ties between the two countries

title: West Bengal: Change and Continuity
content: This collection of essays offers a comprehensive deep dive into West Bengal’s most pressing issues, examining the political, economic, and social factors at play.

title: Dharwad hosts discussion on ‘Gopalakrishna Adiga and T. S. Eliot: Tradition and Modernity’
content: Writer Mahantappa Nandur said that Gopalakrishna Adiga’s poetry continues to attract readers because of its thematic distinctiveness, subtlety, innovation and modern sensibility

title: Leh-bound SpiceJet plane faces engine issue; returns to national capital
content: There were reportedly around 150 people on board the Boeing 737 aircraft, which returned to Delhi after experiencing a technical issue

title: Woman dies, 10 persons sustain injuries as mini-bus overturns near Avadi
content: The driver lost control of the wheel due to drowsiness and crashed the vehicle into a small bridge on the road median near Avadi’s Vellanur

title: ‘Thaai Kizhavi’ trailer: Radikaa Sarathkumar promises a hilarious and thought-provoking comedy
content: Directed by Sivakumar Murugesan and produced by Sivakarthikeyan, the film is set to release in theatres on Friday, February 27

title: Kerala motivational speaker arrested for ‘attempt to sexually assault’ minor girl seeking counselling
content: 59-year-old accused is a retired school principal working as a faculty member for Career Guidance and Adolescent Counselling under Higher Secondary Education dept. The alleged assault took place at the accused’s house in Kannur where the girl had gone seeking counselling support

title: Activists point to questionable expenses in Gescom annual report at KERC public hearing
content: Activists urge KERC to defer approval of financial year 2025 Annual Performance Report (APR) true-up filed by GESCOM until the discrepancies pointed out are examined and corrected through a revised submission

title: Madhya Pradesh government to extend Bhavantar scheme to mustard farmers, says CM Yadav
content: Congress stages a walkout following a heated exchange over the demand to reopen registrations for the Ladli Behna shceme

title: Punjab CM’s ‘Meri Rasoi Yojna’ to benefit 40 lakh families
content: Each ration kit will include 2 kg lentils and sugar, 1 kg salt, 200 grams turmeric, and 1 litre mustard oil; These kits will be provided in addition to wheat received by beneficiaries under the NFSA.

title: Centre approves construction of 5,000 houses for displaced people in Manipur
content: At least 260 people have been killed and thousands rendered homeless in the ethnic violence between Imphal Valley-based Meiteis and hills-based Kuki-Zo groups since May, 2023

title: Female student from Tamil Nadu attacked on IIT Palakkad campus in Kerala
content: Student sustains injuries to her forehead after being struck with a wooden plank by unidentified assailant. Incident sparks protests from students over security concerns

title: Protest against land use rules: Goa MLA Viresh Borkar's health deteriorates, hospitalised
content: Dr. Oscar Rebello, a private doctor, checked the health parameters of MLA Viresh Borkar and advised that he be shifted to the hospital

title: ‘PM is scared of questions’: Congress slams government after IYC chief’s arrest
content: Mr. Chib was arrested by Delhi Police in connection with the shirtless protest staged by a group of youth wing members at the AI Impact Summit in New Delhi last week, officials said

title: ‘Panruti’ Ramachandran’s MGR ADMK announces support for Vijay’s TVK
content: “The TVK is free of the politics of identity. This is why we are supporting him,” Mr. Ramachandran told The Hindu

title: Special train services between Yesvantpur in Bengaluru and Talguppa near Shivamogga for Sirsi Marikamba Devi Jatra Mahotsava
content: SWR will operate a one-trip special train between Yesvantpur and Talguppa, and also extend Yesvantpur–Shivamogga Town Tri-weekly Express up to Talaguppa for one day to handle the rush of passengers for the Sirsi Marikamba Devi Jatra Mahotsava

title: SIR hearing highlights: SC orders Calcutta Chief Justice to additionally deploy civil judges for SIR process, if necessary
content: The Supreme Court orders Election Commission of India to publish the West Bengal voters list on February 28, 2026

title: Food Safety officials raid milk booths, collect samples in Andhra
content: Four people died and few others were hospitalised after allegedly consuming adulterated milk in Andhra Pradesh

title: 'Essential for unifying society': Mohan Bhagwat bats for nationwide UCC
content: Asked about the UGC regulations aimed to curb caste-based discrimination at higher educational institutions, which have been stayed by the Supreme Court, Mr. Bhagwat refused to comment, saying the matter is currently before the top court

title: TMC calls for 'thorough, transparent' probe into Jharkhand air ambulance crash
content: “We urge the authorities to conduct a thorough and transparent investigation to ascertain the precise cause of the crash, and to ensure that robust safeguards are put in place to prevent such tragedies in the future,” TMC said

title: PM Modi pays tribute to ‘charismatic leader’ Jayalalithaa on 78th birth anniversary
content: The Prime Minister also recalled what he said about Jayalalithaa in his monthly radio address, ‘Mann Ki Baat’, on February 22, 2026

title: Meerut Namo Bharat train crosses 1 lakh riders on first full day after launch
content: This came a day after PM Modi formally inaugurated the complete 82-km Delhi-Meerut corridor and the new Meerut Metro link

title: On the independence of the Election Commission
content: An independent Election Commission is the bedrock of Indian democracy. To ensure that it remains so, various safeguards are built into the basic structure of the Constitution

title: Lucknow man shoots father in fit of rage; dismembers body
content: The accused admitted that a dispute arose between him and his father on February 20, and he shot him dead

title: Bihar to explore potential of cooperative farming, teams to visit Gujarat
content: Bihar’s cooperative department also signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with National Federation of Cooperative Sugar Factories Ltd (NFCSF), New Delhi for reviving two closed sugar mills in the State

title: Chhattisgarh GSDP to grow by 8.11% in 2025-26: Economic Survey
content: As per advance estimates, Chhattisgarh’s GSDP at constant price (base year 2011-12) is expected to grow at 8.11% and reach ₹3,58,293 crore in 2025-26 as against ₹3,31,402 crore in FY25, the report mentions.

title: Rally held to urge political parties to add Tamil language conservation in their election manifestos
content: Among the demands of the Collective was a push for mother tongue as the medium of instruction in schools across the country, temple rituals in Tamil Nadu to be conducted in Tamil, and Tamil to be included as a compulsory subject at all colleges

title: Punjab government announces ‘Meri Rasoi’ scheme; Akali Dal terms it poll gimmick
content: Talking to media persons, CM said under ‘Meri Rasoi Yojna’, 40 lakh families will receive free quarterly food kits starting April, in addition to wheat provided under the National Food Security Act.

title: Row over former BJP MP turning away Muslim women from charity event
content: In a video footage of the event circulated on social media, Mr. Jaunpuria was seen enquiring about the recipients’ names. When a woman identified herself as Shakuran Bano, the former MP reacted sharply, asking her to step aside and leave the blanket behind

title: One held for objectionable social media post on PM in Uttar Pradesh
content: Jehanabad police station SHO Pradeep Vishnoi told reporters that based on the complaint filed by Sub-Inspector Gyan Chand, police have registered a case against the accused youth identified as Arbaaz, a resident of Vishen village, under relevant sections.

title: Six hospitalised after eating contaminated food in Indore's Bhagirathpura
content: Around 60 people had eaten food at a birthday party in Bhagirathpura late Saturday night. Following this, some people developed health problems on Sunday, Chief Medical and Health Officer (CMHO) Dr Madhav Hasani stated.

title: Clash breaks out between TMC, ISF in West Bengal's Bhangar
content: The violence was reported when ISF supporters were making preparations for a meeting to be addressed by party MLA Naushad Siddique on February 24.

title: On Camera, 65-Year-Old Man Thrashed By Car Driver In Bengaluru Road Rage
content: The car driver followed the 65-year-old pedestrian and thrashed him despite mediation attempts by passersby. The incident, which took place on Sunday evening, was recorded on CCTV cameras.

title: Youth Congress Chief Arrested Over Shirtless Protest During AI Impact Summit
content: Uday Bhanu Chib, the national president of the Indian Youth Congress, has been arrested after several rounds of questioning in connection with the shirtless protest at Bharat Mandapan during the AI Impact Summit.

title: '250 Officers, 50 Lakh Claims': Judiciary Rushes To Help Poll Body In Bengal
content: In what is effectively the judiciary stepping in to complete the Election Commission's work during the Special Intensive Revision of voter lists in poll-bound West Bengal, the Supreme Court has asked the Calcutta High Court to appoint civil judges

title: 4 Die After Consuming "Adulterated Milk" In Andhra, 1 Arrested
content: Four people have died after allegedly consuming adulterated milk in Rajamahendravaram city in Andhra Pradesh, the East Godavari district administration said on Monday.

title: "Don't Know How Long I'll Be Around": Trump After Intruder Shot At Mar-a-Lago
content: "I don't know how long I'll be around," said US President Donald Trump a day after an armed intruder was shot dead in his Florida home.

title: "Tell Sons Of B***es To Fall Back": Leaked Audio Reveals El Mencho Threatened Cops
content: A leaked 2016 audio clip with the voice of El Mencho, the leader of Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG), has resurfaced on social media after he was killed in a recent military operation in Mexico.

title: Leh-Bound SpiceJet Plane Suffers Technical Snag, Returns To Delhi
content: A SpiceJet flight carrying around 150 passengers to Leh returned safely to Delhi Airport on Tuesday shortly after takeoff from the airport after experiencing a "technical issue".

title: Politics Of Rehabilitation: Why Wayanad Is In Focus Ahead Of Kerala Polls
content: The 2024 Wayanad landslides were the deadliest in Kerala's history. Official records submitted to Parliament confirmed 298 deaths, including 32 individuals declared dead months after disappearing.

title: "Family Wiped Out": Relatives Mourn Jharkhand Air Ambulance Crash's Victims
content: The Jharkhand air ambulance crash has left several families shattered, as they try to cope with the sudden loss of seven people who had boarded the aircraft with the sole purpose of saving a life.

title: Man Found Dead In Car At Delhi Mall Parking
content: A 42-year-old man was found dead inside a car in the parking lot of a mall in east Delhi's Mayur Vihar, police said on Tuesday.

title: Madhya Pradesh's Bhojshala Dispute: Court Seeks Responses on ASI Survey Report
content: The Indore Bench of the Madhya Pradesh High Court on Monday heard the long-pending matter concerning the disputed Bhojshala Kamal Maula complex in Dhar.

title: Newlywed Dalit Couple Driven Out Of Temple In Karnataka
content: A newly married Dalit couple had visited the Arasamma Temple in Goni village, when a man belonging to an upper-caste allegedly pretended to be possessed by a deity, ordering them to leave.

title: Vijay's Possible North Chennai Poll Debut Sparks Buzz In DMK Fortress
content: A day after TVK general secretary Aadhav Arjuna hinted that party chief and actor Vijay could contest from a North Madras constituency in the upcoming Tamil Nadu Assembly elections, anticipation is building across the industrial belt of North Chennai

title: Canada's Big Move Against Mumbai Attack Accused Tahawwur Rana Before PM Carney's India Visit
content: The Canadian government has reportedly started proceedings to revoke the citizenship of 26/11 Mumbai terror attack mastermind Tahawwur Hussain Rana.

title: Ukraine Marks 4 Years of War With Russia Amid Ongoing Conflict
content: Ukraine was on Tuesday marking the fourth anniversary of Russia's full-scale invasion, with a show of solidarity from its staunchest allies and no immediate end in sight to Europe's bloodiest conflict since World War II.

title: 11,000 Flights Grounded, 500,000 Homes Left Without Power As Storm Hits US
content: A powerful winter storm started to taper off across the Northeast Monday evening after smashing records and dropping more than a foot of snow in eight states.

title: Massive Irregularities At Madhya Pradesh's Only Medical University: Auditor
content: After NDTV's ground investigations exposed the nursing scam and, more recently, the deep-rooted paramedical education crisis in Madhya Pradesh, the Comptroller and Auditor General of India has now formally confirmed serious irregularities at the stat

title: First Ex-Prince Andrew, Then Ex-UK Ambassador Mandelson: Keir Starmer Can't Catch A Break
content: On Thursday, it was the image of the former Prince Andrew slumped at the back of a police car, looking shell-shocked. On Monday, it was the turn of a stony-faced Peter Mandelson, his disgraced ex-ambassador to Washington.

title: 'You May Leave If You Want': Karnataka Minister vs Party Leader At Key Meet
content: A tense exchange unfolded during a Karnataka Development Programme (KDP) review meeting in Dharwad district on Monday, as Karnataka minister Santosh Lad and Congress MLC FH Jakkappanavar locked horns over issues concerning SC/ST communities.

title: Actively considering issue of airfare fluctuations, Centre tells Supreme Court
content: The plea had also pointed to the reduction in free check-in baggage allowance for economy class passengers from 25 kg to 15 kg, “thereby converting what was earlier part of the ticketed service into a new revenue stream”.

title: Kuno National Park to get 8 cheetahs from Botswana on Feb. 28
content: Botswana is the third African nation to send cheetahs to India as part of Project Cheetah. Two batches of cheetahs have arrived from Namibia and South Africa since the project was kickstarted in September, 2022

title: Odisha deported 73 Bangladeshi nationals since May 2025: CM
content: Documents of 2,261 persons suspected of their nationality were examined, Odisha CM informed State Assembly

title: Kolar MLA warns of cutting power supply to Tata-Airbus helicopter assembly unit in Vemagal in Karnataka
content: Kottur Manjunath, Kolar Congress MLA, has threatened to cut power supply to the recently-inaugurated Tata-Airbus helicopter assembly unit in Vemagal, if it doesn’t draw power from a separate industrial feeder

title: First-time MLAs’ letter to Congress high command seeking Cabinet berths surfaces
content: An undated letter, purportedly signed by 31 first-time Congress legislators demanding at least five Cabinet berths during the proposed reshuffle, surfaced, even as the Congress government battles an internal crisis over leadership

title: IISc researchers find out how the brain suppresses itch during stress
content: IISc said that itch and pain are both unpleasant sensations triggered by harmful or irritating stimuli, but they lead to different behavioural responses

title: Joint inspection held for proposed elevated rotary flyover at IOC junction near Baiyappanahalli in Bengaluru
content: The inspection was on coordinating the construction of a more than 3-km-long elevated rotary flyover at IOC Junction and an additional two-lane railway overbridge at the Baiyyappanahalli railway level crossing

title: Cabinet gives its nod for completing takeover of metro rail phase one before March 31
content: Cabinet approves comprehensive health coverage for employees and setting up directorate of secondary health

title: Interfaith marriages not prohibited under new U.P. conversion law: HC
content: Allahabad HC orders police protection for 12 interfaith live-in couples, asks respondents to refrain from interfering with their privacy; State had argued the relationships were unlawful

title: Jharkhand air ambulance crash: Bodies of seven killed brought to hospital for post-mortem
content: SDPO Shubham Khandelwal said the bodies of all seven persons on board have been retrieved. They have been identified as Captain Vivek Vikas Bhagat, Captain Savrajdeep Singh, Sanjay Kumar, Dr Vikas Kumar Gupta, Sachin Kumar Mishra, Archana Devi, and Dhuru Kumar.

title: Bharat Taxi will guarantee minimum base rate per kilometre for all drivers: Amit Shah
content: The cooperative ride-hailing platform would return 80% of profits to drivers based on kilometres driven, with the remaining 20% is retained as cooperative capital, Union Home Minister Amit Shah says

title: Amazon opens its second largest office in Asia in Bengaluru
content: This 1.1 million square feet, 12-storey campus will support over 7,000 employees across ecommerce, operations, payments, technology, and seller services across India

title: Canadian PM Carney to arrive in India this week
content: Carney to meet Modi on March 2 and discuss new tie-ups in energy, AI, defence; officials hope the visit will reset ties ruptured by allegations over killing of Khalistani separatist leader Nijjar

title: RSS-backed trade union to launch nationwide protest against Centre over workers’ issues on February 25
content: Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh leader Pawan Kumar says the protest is against the neglect of workers’ issues by the government

title: Kuno National Park to receive eight cheetahs from Botswana on February 28
content: Botswana is the third African nation to send cheetahs to India as part of Project Cheetah. Two batches of cheetahs have arrived from Namibia and South Africa since the project was kickstarted in September, 2022

title: Navy to commission Anjadip warship in Chennai on February 27
content: According to Defence Ministry, the vessel is engineered to act as a 'Dolphin Hunter', focused on detection, tracking and neutralisation of enemy submarines in coastal areas

title: Pray for peace to return in Manipur: Boong director after BAFTA win
content: “The walk up till here felt like the last few steps to reach the summit of a mountain we never knew we were climbing in the first place. I just want to use this opportunity to say that we pray for peace to return in Manipur,” Boong director Lakshmipriya Devi said in her acceptance speech

title: Can a ban solve Karnataka’s under-16 phone problem?
content: Experts and parents remain divided on whether prohibition, regulation or guided usage would be the more practical path forward

title: U.S. deal, Epstein links are shameful, not peaceful protests, Rahul tells Modi
content: The Congress condemns the arrest of Youth Congress leaders, alleges that family members of Youth Congress workers are harassed. PM Modi had called Youth Congress leaders’ ‘shirtless’ protest at the Delhi AI summit ‘naked politics’ and said that it was shameful.

title: Waiting for an opportunity to serve you, Modi tells people of West Bengal
content: In an open letter, the PM says entire nation is worried about the State as it sinks into the “darkness of anarchy” and urges people to take an oath to build a ‘Viksit West Bengal’ in 2026

title: Labour Ministry changes norms for scholarship to children of unorganised workers
content: In another reform measure, the Ministry decided to settle 7.11 lakh inoperative accounts of the Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO)

title: IDFC First Bank fraud case flagged in Haryana Assembly
content: The alertness of State government departments had shed light on the issue, following which the government had immediately de-empanelled IDFC First Bank, Chief Minister says

title: Hospitals cannot treat doctors like workmen in a factory: Madras High Court
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh says one hospital cannot treat another hospital as a rival and include non-compete and non-solicit clauses in agreements with doctors

title: Tamil Nadu electorate stands at 5.67 crore after Special Intensive Revision
content: The Sholinganallur Assembly constituency in Chengalpattu district continues to have the highest number of electors, with 5,36,991, and the Harbour constituency in Chennai district has the lowest number of voters, with 1,16,896

title: UNICEF experts stress rights-based approach to tackling non-communicable diseases among children
content: NCDs are not often talked about in context of children and young population, says Raoul Bermejo, health specialist and lead on non-communicable diseases, UNICEF headquarters, New York

title: 250 judicial officers begin work on resolving pending SIR cases in West Bengal
content: Leaves cancelled, important cases shifted to other courts; February 28 schedule of final voter list publication remains uncertain

title: It is for RGUHS and experts to decide on providing key or model answers to subjective questions in MBBS course exams: Karnataka High Court
content: It is not open to this Court to evolve a method for evaluating answer scripts and to supplant the method provided under the ordinance, it said

title: Parliamentary panel questions timing of PM Modi’s Israel visit amid regional tensions
content: Foreign Secretary says security considerations guide all high‑level travel; MPs flag cuts in MEA budget and Chabahar allocation

title: Telangana Budget session 2026-27 to start from March 16
content: Budget to be presented on March 20, Telangana Cabinet finalises dates for Budget session after marathon discussion

title: 1,000-year-old gold tomb found in Panama shows ancient treasures and powerful leaders

title: Top 25 rankings, play of the week and what to watch
content: the Razorbacks beat the Musketeers 7-6 in a road series against Tennessee . the Vols dropped seven spots to no. 20 in this week's rankings . they're facing the top team in the country in UCLA on Friday .

title: A gold medal 46 years in the making: Inside Team USA's epic win over Canada
content: Connor Hellebuyck and canada's Jordan Binnington win the men's hockey gold medal . he is the reigning NHL MVP and winner of the Vezina Trophy as the league's best goaltender . the game went into overtime on tuesday .

title: Kings of the hot corner: Buster Olney ranks baseball's best third basemen
content: we rank the best of the best at third base . we will roll out a position per day over the next two weeks . the goal of this exercise is to identify the best players for the 2026 season, not who might be best in five years or over their career.

title: Way-too-early preview for the 2030 Olympics
content: the 2030 Olympics will be spread across the country on sunday . the ice seemed tilted very much in the american's favor for the first time . it's clear Team USA is building a potential dynasty . if you paid attention in the lead-up and during the Games, it is clear team USA could have some growing pain .

title: 🎖️ Shots of gold: Winter Olympics, in pictures
content: the 2026 Milan Cortina Olympics have come to a close, bringing thrilling action and memorable moments in spades . we compiled collages that take a look at the story of each of the Games' days overall, as well as one specific snapshot of particular significance .

title: Who's the best second baseman in MLB? Buster Olney ranks the top 10
content: ESPN's Buster Olney ranked the best of the best at second base . we will roll out a position per day over the next two weeks . the most coveted free agent in the fall will be Tarik Skubal .

title: 'Raw' results: Styles WWE Hall of Fame-bound, Elimination Chamber matches set
content: Randy Orton expresses his desire to win another world title . the final competitors for the men's and women's Elimination chamber matches will earn guaranteed spots at WrestleMania 42 in April . there are still some details that need to be ironed out .

title: USA Basketball's road to 2028: New era, new coach, new decisions
content: in 2024, a team USA squad full of stars, role players, up-and-comers and legends survived two thrillers . a 95-91 win over Nikola Jokic -led Serbia squad and an exhausting 98-87 clincher over host France . it doesn't appear that USA Basketball's graybearded Avengers will reassemble to chase a sixth consecutive gold .

title: Olympic standouts, disappointments from all 32 NHL teams
content: the 2026 Olympic men's hockey tournament ended in thrilling fashion . both teams were comprised of players -- many of them superstars . all but one of the countries had at least one active NHL player on the roster . it's time to assess which players will be coming home content with how they performed .
